analysis.summary: Vue SFC that renders a scalable SVG ‘gallery’ icon with a customizable fill color.
analysis.purpose: Provides a reusable IconGallery component in the project's icon library, allowing other parts of the app to display a uniform gallery icon with optional styling overrides.

components.name: IconGallery
responsibilities: Accept a `fill` prop to control the SVG fill color
Expose all standard SVG attributes and classes via `$attrs`
Render the SVG markup for a gallery icon

functions.name: defineProps
functions.description: Defines a single `fill` prop, defaulting to a CSS variable-driven black color.

usage: Import and register locally or globally:
Any additional SVG attributes or classes can be passed through via component attributes.
notes: No `<style>` block—styling is driven entirely by SVG attributes and inherited CSS variables.
Built with `<script setup>` for a lean, functionally stateless component.
Accepts arbitrary SVG attributes (e.g. width/height overrides) through `$attrs`.
